title: The Fugitive S01E02 The Witch DVDRip DivX
description:
The Fugitive Season 1 (1963)
S01E02 The Witch
First aired: 9/24/1963 
While working as a handyman in a backwater community in Missouri, Kimble has a few run-ins with a young girl named Jenny Ammory, who is a pathological liar and speaks to a rag doll she calls &#039;Nyet,&#039; which she keeps at a nearby pond. Jenny uses Kimble as an excuse when she&#039;s late for school when she claims that a man attacked her. When Kimble shows up making a routine delivery of supplies to the school, Jenny identifies him as the man who attacked her. As Jenny&#039;s teacher, Emily Norton, speaks to Kimble about Jenny&#039;s compulsive lying, Jenny runs home and tells her mother she saw her teacher and the local handyman kissing in the barn. Kimble gets roughed up by his co-workers while Emily gets fired and both are advised to leave town. Kimble goes to a school hearing on Emily&#039;s behalf and tries to clear her by catching Jenny in a lie. But his plan backfires when the skeptic townspeople believe Jenny and decide to form a lynching party to track Kimble down. Elisha Cook Jr. guest stars.
(There was a movie remake of the 1936 movie "These Three" (Miriam Hopkins, Merle Oberon) called "The Children&#039;s Hour" (Lillian Hellman play, 1934) starring Shirley McClaine and Audrey Hepburn that had this same plot that came out in 1962.)

Cast: David Janssen as Dr. Richard Kimble, Barry Morse as Lt. Philip Gerard, Bill Raisch as Fred Johnson (The One-Armed Man), Diane Brewster (flashbacks) as Helen Kimble, J.D.Cannon as Lloyd Chandler, William Conrad as Narrator (voice).

Guest cast: Crahan Denton (H. R. Ammory) , Pat Crowley (Emily Norton), Madeleine Sherwood (Mrs. Ammory), Arch Johnson (Ty Tyson), Gina Gillespie (Jenny), Elisha Cook Jr. (Sailor), George Mitchell (Mr. Sturgis), Ray Teal (McNary), Claudia Bryar (Mrs. Sturgis)
